verb.description: Obtain or bring about by discussion.
examples: he negotiated a new contract with the sellers

verb.description: Find a way over or through (an obstacle or difficult path)
examples: there was a puddle to be negotiated

verb.description: Transfer (a check, bill, or other document) to the legal ownership of another person.

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin negotiat- done in the course of business, from the verb negotiari, from negotium business, from neg- not + otium leisure.
